org.gearvrf.animation

Interface GVROnRepeat

  • All Superinterfaces:
    GVROnFinish

    public interface GVROnRepeat
extends GVROnFinish
    Optional on-finish callback, with options for controlling repetition

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean iteration(GVRAnimation animation, int count)
      Optional callback, that lets you stop an animation when your app reaches a desired state.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.gearvrf.animation.GVROnFinish

        finished

    • Method Detail

      • iteration

        boolean iteration(GVRAnimation animation,
                  int count)
        Optional callback, that lets you stop an animation when your app reaches a desired state. When you set a GVROnRepeat callback, iteration will be called after each iteration: returning false will stop the animation.

        The repeat count defaults to 2, but setting a GVROnRepeat callback also sets the repeat count to a negative number, so that the animation is under your callback's control. Do note that setting a positive repeat count after setting the GVROnRepeat callback will override this: iteration is not called when the repeat count is >= 0.

        Parameters:
        animation - The animation that just finished, so you can use the same callback with multiple animations.
        count - The number of repetitions since the animation started
        Returns:
        true to allow the animation to repeat. false will stop the animation: the engine will unregister the animation and call GVROnFinish.finished(GVRAnimation).
